snippet: The nation’s top military officer said that even if the Pentagon intervened in Syria, there were no moderate rebel groups ready to fill any power vacuum.
abstract: Gen Martin E Dempsey, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, tells Congress that the Pentagon could forcefully intervene in Syria to tip balance in civil war, but that there are no moderate rebel groups now ready to fill any power vacuum there.
lead_paragraph: The nation’s top military officer said that even if the Pentagon intervened in Syria, there were no moderate rebel groups ready to fill any power vacuum.

headline.main: General Says Syrian Rebels Aren’t Ready to Take Power
headline.print_headline: General Says Syrian Rebels Aren’t Ready To Take Power
